{"id":512330588,"lang":"cpp","time":"1 year, 2 months","timestamp":1624499890,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"28 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/512330588/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"59.5 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    \n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n       \n        stack <TreeNode*> s;\n        TreeNode* cur = root ;\n        \n        TreeNode* x =NULL;\n        TreeNode* y =NULL;\n        \n       \n        \n        TreeNode  *pre= new TreeNode(INT_MIN);\n        while(cur!=NULL || !s.empty()){\n            if(cur!=NULL){\n                s.push(cur);\n                cur = cur->left;\n            }\n            else {\n                cur =s.top();\n                s.pop();\n                if(pre->val > cur->val){\n                    if(x == NULL){\n                        x =pre;\n                    }\n                    if(x!=NULL){\n                        y = cur;\n                    }\n                }\n                    pre = cur;\n                    cur = cur->right;\n                } \n        }\n        \n        int temp = x->val;\n        x->val = y->val;\n        y->val = temp;\n        \n        \n        \n        \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
